arm_group.description: One week Low Na diet (10 mmol/d) followed by ine week high Na diet (200 mmol/d) followed by 2 weeks administration of amiloride (10 mg the 1 st week and the 20mg).

brief_summary.textblock:
Nedd4.2 is a regulator of ENac, a transporter of sodium involved in the regulation of salt
      retention by the kidney. The study address the consequence of a frequent genetic variation
      leading expected to impact the function of Nedd4 and in turn, the ability of kidneys to
      excrete salt intake. Our hypothesis is that the genetic variants of Nedd4.2 could constitute
      a genetic predisposition to (or protection against) salt-sensitive hypertension.

clinical_study.brief_title: Genetic Determinant of Blood Pressure Sensitivity to Salt Intake

detailed_description.textblock:
Subjects were submitted one week to a low sodium-high potassium diet, and then switch to a
      high sodium,-low potassium diet for two weeks. the last week, subject were taken a 20 MG
      daily dose of amiloride, a potassium sparing diuretic.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  healthy volunteers

          -  between 18 and 35 years odl

          -  BMI between 18 and 28 Kg per m2

          -  non smokers

          -  no active disease

          -  no alcool or drug abuse

keyword: BMI between 18 and 28 Kg per m2
no alcool or drug abuse or smoke
clinical_study.official_title: Clinical, Pharmacological and Biological Investigations of a Polymorphism of Nedd4 , a Regulatory Protein of the Epithelial Sodium Channel

oversight_info.authority: France: Committee for the Protection of Personnes

primary_outcome.description: 24h AMBP will be measured weekly for the duration of study, an expected average of 3 weeks
primary_outcome.measure: Difference in Blood Pressure among genotypes
primary_outcome.time_frame: 24h AMBP will be measured weekly for the duration of study, an expected average of 3 weeks

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

secondary_outcome.description: 24h AMBP was measured fourth : at the beginning of the study,at the end of the low sodium-high potassium diet, after one week under the high sodium-low potassium diet and at the end of amiloride treatment under  high sodium-low potassium diet

clinical_study.study_design: Intervention Model: Single Group Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Basic Science
clinical_study.why_stopped: end of recruitment period was reach
